intro: Epilobium mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, well-drained soils, often in woodland or streamside habitats. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Epilobium mexicanum is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other plants known for their ornamental value and ecological importance.
